channel.title: CVE Feed for wpopal -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for wpopal -- all products

item.title: CVE-2022-29449|2024-09-16T16:18:41.740Z -- wpopal -- opal%20hotel%20room%20booking%20%28wordpress%20plugin%29
item.description: Authenticated (contributor or higher user role) Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Opal Hotel Room Booking plugin <= 1.2.7 at WordPress.

item.title: CVE-2024-7649|2024-08-10T14:16:47.139Z -- wpopal -- opal%20membership
item.description: The Opal Membership plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via checkout form fields in all versions up to, and including, 1.2.4 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-3666|2024-08-01T20:19:59.907Z -- wpopal -- opal%20estate%20pro%20%E2%80%93%20property%20management%20and%20submission
item.description: The Opal Estate Pro – Property Management and Submission plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the agent latitude and longitude parameters in all versions up to, and including, 1.7.6 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-3666|2024-06-04T17:32:05.837Z -- wpopal -- opal%20estate%20pro%20%E2%80%93%20property%20management%20and%20submission
item.description: The Opal Estate Pro – Property Management and Submission plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the agent latitude and longitude parameters in all versions up to, and including, 1.7.6 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-33649|2024-06-06T17:51:36.940Z -- wpopal -- opal%20widgets%20for%20elementor
item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in WpOpal Opal Widgets For Elementor allows Stored XSS.This issue affects Opal Widgets For Elementor: from n/a through 1.6.9.

item.title: CVE-2024-33649|2024-08-02T02:36:04.537Z -- wpopal -- opal%20widgets%20for%20elementor
item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in WpOpal Opal Widgets For Elementor allows Stored XSS.This issue affects Opal Widgets For Elementor: from n/a through 1.6.9.

item.title: CVE-2024-7648|2024-08-10T03:23:26.394Z -- wpopal -- opal%20membership
item.description: The Opal Membership plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Sensitive Information Exposure in all versions up to, and including, 1.2.4 via the private notes functionality on payments which utilizes WordPress comments. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with subscriber-level access and above, to view private notes via recent comments that should be restricted to just administrators.

item.title: CVE-2024-7649|2024-08-10T03:23:27.028Z -- wpopal -- opal%20membership
item.description: The Opal Membership plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via checkout form fields in all versions up to, and including, 1.2.4 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-7648|2024-08-12T14:31:45.025Z -- wpopal -- opal%20membership
item.description: The Opal Membership plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Sensitive Information Exposure in all versions up to, and including, 1.2.4 via the private notes functionality on payments which utilizes WordPress comments. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with subscriber-level access and above, to view private notes via recent comments that should be restricted to just administrators.
